summary: This is an email chain from February 2020 between federal prosecutors in the USAO Southern District of New York (USANYS) discussing subpoena strategy for obtaining records from Interlochen Center for the Arts regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails cover the drafting of two subpoenas: one for donor information and one for student records, with considerations for non-disclosure orders.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a donor to Interlochen Center for the Arts whose records are being subpoenaed by federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as a donor to Interlochen Center for the Arts whose records are being subpoenaed by federal prosecutors.

connections.description: Both are named together as donors to Interlochen Center for the Arts, and federal prosecutors are seeking their donor records via subpoena as part of the same investigation.

events.title: Drafting of Subpoenas to Interlochen
events.description: Federal prosecutors draft two subpoenas for Interlochen Center for the Arts: one for donor information regarding Epstein and Maxwell, and one for student records.

events.title: Prosecutor Email Review of Subpoenas
events.description: Prosecutors exchange emails to review and approve the drafted subpoenas and a Non-Disclosure Order (NDO) application before sending them to their chiefs.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell's connections to Interlochen Center for the Arts as of February 2020.
The investigation sought two categories of records from Interlochen: donor information related to Epstein and Maxwell, and student records.
Interlochen's attorney confirmed the institution would not disclose a subpoena for donor records but was obligated under FERPA to disclose a subpoena for student records to the affected students.
Prosecutors prepared a Non-Disclosure Order (NDO) package for the student records subpoena to prevent disclosure.
The email chain shows internal coordination among prosecutors to finalize legal documents before seeking approval from their superiors.
